Short Bio

Dr. Sisi Duan is a Researcher at the Institute for Advanced Study, Tsinghua University. She is also affiliated with Zhongguancun Laboratory and State Key Laboratory of Cryptography and Digital Economy Security. She received her Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of California, Davis in 2014 (Advisors: Prof. Karl Levitt and Sean Peisert). She got her bachelor's degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering from the University of Hong Kong in 2010. Prior to joining Tsinghua University in 2020, she was an Assistant Professor at the University of Maryland, Baltimore County from 2017 to 2020, a Weinberg fellow at Oak Ridge National Laboratory from 2015 to 2017. Dr. Duan's research interests include distributed systems security, blockchain, and applied cryptography.

I'm always looking for postdocs, PhD students, and research interns. Send me an email if you are interested.
